pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:0.4: The sub-chapter on containing living beings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.2: a monk who was traveling through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī walked through the gateway of a certain village.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.3: A woman who had had an argument with her husband walked through the same gateway. When she saw that monk, she asked him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.8: Soon afterwards that woman’s husband also left that village. He asked around,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.11: He then followed after them, caught that monk, and gave him a beating.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.12: The monk sat down fuming at the foot of a tree.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.13: And the woman said to her husband,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.15: I was the one who went with him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.19: That monk then went to Sāvatthī where he told the monks what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.20: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.21: “How could a monk travel by arrangement with a woman?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.22: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.27: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.28.1: ‘If a monk travels by arrangement with a woman, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.6: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.10: if he makes an arrangement like this: he says, “Let’s go,” and she replies, “Yes, let’s go, Venerable;” or she says, “Let’s go, Venerable,” and he replies, “Yes, let’s go;” or he says, “Let’s go today,” “Let’s go tomorrow,” or “Let’s go the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.11: Even just to the next village:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.12: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.13: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.1: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he travels by arrangement with her, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.2: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he travels by arrangement with her, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.3: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he travels by arrangement with her, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.4: If the monk makes an arrangement, but the woman does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.5: If he travels by arrangement with a female spirit, with a female ghost, with a _paṇḍaka_, with a female animal in the form of a woman, even just to the next village, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.6: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.7: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.8: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.2: if he goes, but not by arrangement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.3: if the woman has made an arrangement, but he has not expressed his agreement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.4: if he goes, but not according to the arrangement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.8: The training rule on arrangements, the seventh, is finished.
